page.title: 02LIMESTONE QUARRIES
page.content: { The most obvious industrial activity in the area is quarrying. The limestone plateau begins near the western edge of our area; only the corner near the Stanley Moor reservoir is Millstone Grit. The limestone was formed about {280 {million years ago} when the area was covered by a shallow sea As it is very pure the limestone has been quarried since the 16th century. On Grin Low th you can see mounds of ash left after the lime had been burnt in kilns. There is a very large disused quarry near Ladmanlow which is now a caravan site. There is another old quarry near the site of the old Harpur Hill Station. You can now walk along part of the line of the Cromford & High Peak Railway which served the quarries
